description:
Seina Yamada is unlucky... so unlucky that when he stumbles upon a recruiter looking for his senpai Tenchi he gets taken instead. Forced into the Galaxy Police, his luck begins to change. A natural to randomly jumping near pirates, he is assigned his own decoy to draw out pirates. His luck brings him into the lives of four women who have a habit of cancelling out his bad luck, turning it into good. Armed with this luck, they pilot the most powerful ships in the Tenchi Universe to defeat the Da Ruma pirates. Now the only uncertainty is whether the sexy Amane Kaunaq, a former model turned into a GP detective, sturdy Kiriko Masaki, who has known Seina for years, the mysterious Ryoko Balta, a former pirate named after the legendary one, or the child-like Neju Na Melmas, a powerful 2000 year-old priestess, will win Seina.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Polyamorous
tags.description: Features a character who is in a consenting relationship with multiple people at one time.

node.description:
__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/johnburgmeier)__

He is the son of [Linda Young](https://anilist.co/staff/95252).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/水谷優子)

Wife of [Mizuho Nishikubo](https://anilist.co/staff/102460/).

Passed away due to breast cancer on May 17, 2016.

Yousuke Kuroda is a Japanese screenwriter. He is affiliated with Studio Orphee and serves as the inside director (board of directors member).

Kuroda is a prolific writer in the anime industry. Having authored and scripted numerous anime series. Including several original productions. Some of the most notable are Infinite Ryvius, Scryed, Please☆Teacher!, Mobile Suit Gundam 00, and Waiting in the Summer.

In 2003, he won the Individual Award at the 8th Animation Kobe event.
Kouichi Oohata is a director and mecha designer best known for creating the Gunbuster from *Top wo Nerae!*

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/梶島正樹)

He entered [Studio Junio](https://anilist.co/studio/280/) after graduating from Osaka Design College. Kajishima admired [Kenichi Sonoda](https://anilist.co/staff/97942/)'s designs and came to Tokyo to join the [Gall Force](https://anilist.co/anime/2060/) production team. After Gall Force, he continued to do a bunch of contract work for [AIC](https://anilist.co/studio/48/) as a freelancer and became mainly known for creating the [Tenchi Muyou!](https://anilist.co/anime/696/) universe.

Besides his anime works, he's also written doujinshi and novels.
Barry Watson is president and CEO of Illumitoon Entertainment. He was formerly a producer and voice director for FUNimation Entertainment.

Hiroaki Inoue is a long-time producer for AIC. He was also to join Gainax, when it had been founded and served as producer on The Wings of Honneamise and Gunbuster.

Inoue won the Takumi Shibano Award for outstanding fan activity, 1998.

He was the Chairman of the: 6th SF Show (1984); 1st-4th SF X'mas (1983-86); and the Bid Chairman for Worldcon Nippon. He is now the Chairman for the Japanese Worldcon in 2007
Inoue was the co-Chair for both Mig-con (27th Japan National Science Fiction Convention, in 1988); and the Captain Future Con in 1990 (1990).

Since 1977 he has been a member of the Space Force, Chief of the General Staff 1979-1987.
And JASFIC (Japanese Association for Science Fiction International Communication), 2002-present, Chair.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nabeshin_afro)__ __Shinichi Watanabe__ is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist for anime, while also being a voice actor. Shinichi is best known for his over-the-top adaption of Rikudo Koshi's [Excel Saga](https://anilist.co/anime/379/Heppoko-Jikken-Animation-Excel-Saga), in which he appears as the character Nabeshin. In addition to his appearance in Excel Saga and [Puni Puni Poemy](https://anilist.co/anime/564/Puni-PuniPoemii), his likeness has also appeared as NB in [Tenchi Muyo! GXP](https://anilist.co/anime/1133/Tenchi-Muyo-GXP), Inu-Afro in [Dotto Koni-Chan](https://anilist.co/anime/1684/Dotto-Konichan) and in small role in [Mahoromatic](https://anilist.co/anime/276/Mahoromatic). He also does an unmistakable cameo of Nabeshin, which can be seen in [Nurse Witch Komugi](https://anilist.co/anime/615/Nurse-Witch-Komugichan/), although Shinichi had nothing to do with that project. In addition he made an appearance in the show [EyeShield 21](https://anilist.co/anime/15/Eyeshield-21). More recently he made an appearance in episode 32 of [Hayate no Gotoku](https://anilist.co/anime/2026/Hayate-no-Gotoku). Shinichi claims that the nickname Nabeshin (which is an obvious combination of "nabe" in Watanabe, and "shin" in Shinichi) came from God himself. (Not to be confused with the director [Watanabe Shinichirou](https://anilist.co/staff/97009/Shinichirou-Watanabe), which is most known for directing Cowboy Bebop)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/梶島正樹)

Kajishima admired [Kenichi Sonoda](https://anilist.co/staff/97942/)'s designs and came to Tokyo to join the [Gall Force](https://anilist.co/anime/2060/) production team.
